cooking_method:
1. Cook penne pasta in boiling salted water until al dente. Reserve 1/2 cup pasta cooking water.
2. Meanwhile, in a large skillet, heat olive oil over medium heat. Add minced garlic and red pepper flakes and cook until fragrant.
3. Add diced tomatoes to skillet and cook until they start to break down.
4. Add reserved pasta cooking water to skillet and bring to a simmer. Reduce heat to low.
5. Drain penne pasta and add to skillet. Toss until coated in sauce. Serve immediately.

1. Slice tomatoes and mozzarella cheese into rounds.
2. Layer tomato and mozzarella slices on a plate, alternating between the two.
3. Garnish with fresh basil leaves.
4. Drizzle with balsamic vinegar and olive oil. Season with salt and pepper to taste.

1. Cook spaghetti in boiling salted water until al dente. Reserve 1/2 cup pasta cooking water.
2. Meanwhile, in a food processor, blend together basil leaves, pine nuts, grated Parmesan cheese, minced garlic, and olive oil until smooth.
3. Add reserved pasta cooking water to pesto sauce and blend until combined.
4. Drain spaghetti and add to pesto sauce. Toss until coated in sauce. Serve immediately.

1. Preheat oven to 375°F.
2. Slice baguette into rounds and brush with olive oil. Bake for 10-15 minutes until golden brown.
3. Meanwhile, dice tomatoes and mince garlic.
4. In a bowl, mix together diced tomatoes, minced garlic, and chopped fresh basil. Season with salt and pepper.
5. Top each baguette slice with tomato mixture. Serve immediately.

1. Brew espresso and let cool.
2. In a bowl, whisk together mascarpone cheese, heavy cream, and sugar until smooth.
3. Dip ladyfingers in espresso and arrange in a single layer in a serving dish.
4. Spoon a layer of mascarpone mixture over ladyfingers. Repeat layers until all ingredients are used, ending with a layer of mascarpone mixture.
5. Refrigerate tiramisu for at least 2 hours before serving.

1. Cook spaghetti in boiling salted water until al dente. Reserve 1/2 cup pasta cooking water.
2. Meanwhile, in a skillet, cook diced pancetta until crispy. Remove from heat.
3. In a bowl, whisk together grated Parmesan cheese, beaten eggs, and freshly ground black pepper.
4. Add cooked spaghetti to skillet with pancetta. Toss until coated in pancetta grease.
5. Remove skillet from heat and add Parmesan-egg mixture. Toss until eggs are cooked and sauce is creamy. If sauce is too thick, add reserved pasta cooking water.
6. Serve immediately.

1. Preheat oven to 450°F.
2. Roll out pizza dough and transfer to a baking sheet.
3. Brush pizza dough with olive oil.
4. Slice tomatoes and mozzarella cheese into rounds.
5. Layer tomato and mozzarella slices on pizza dough, alternating between the two.
6. Garnish with fresh basil leaves.
7. Bake pizza in preheated oven for 10-12 minutes, or until crust is golden brown.
8. Serve immediately.

1. In a large pot, cook ground beef over medium heat until browned. Remove beef from pot and set aside.
2. In the same pot, sauté diced onion and minced garlic until onion is translucent.
3. Add diced tomatoes and tomato paste to pot. Stir until combined.
4. Return cooked ground beef to pot. Stir until combined.
5. Reduce heat to low and simmer sauce for 1-2 hours, stirring occasionally.
6. Serve with cooked spaghetti or other pasta of your choice.

1. Cook spaghetti in a large pot of salted boiling water until al dente.
2. While the pasta is cooking, fry pancetta in a pan until crisp.
3. In a bowl, whisk together 3 egg yolks and 1/2 cup of grated Parmesan cheese.
4. Drain the pasta and add it to the pan with the pancetta. Toss well.
5. Remove the pan from the heat and add the egg yolk mixture, stirring quickly to prevent the eggs from curdling.
6. Serve with freshly ground black pepper.

1. Preheat the oven to 350°F.
2. In a large oven-proof pan, brown chicken pieces in 2 tbsp of olive oil over medium-high heat. Remove chicken from the pan and set aside.
3. In the same pan, sauté finely chopped onion, carrot, and celery until softened.
4. Add 1 cup of canned tomatoes and cook for 5 minutes.
5. Add the chicken back to the pan and pour over 1 cup of chicken broth.
6. Cover the pan with a lid or foil and bake for 1 hour.
7. Serve with crusty bread.

1. In a large mixing bowl, combine 4 cups of flour, 1 tbsp of yeast, and 1 tbsp of salt. Mix well.
2. Add 1 1/2 cups of warm water and 1/4 cup of olive oil. Mix until a soft dough forms.
3. Knead the dough for 5-10 minutes until smooth and elastic.
4. Cover the bowl with a towel and let the dough rise in a warm place for 1-2 hours.
5. Preheat the oven to 425°F. Grease a baking sheet with olive oil.
6. Punch the dough down and transfer it to the baking sheet. Press the dough out into a rectangle shape.
7. Drizzle more olive oil over the dough and sprinkle with chopped rosemary and coarse salt.
8. Bake for 15-20 minutes or until golden brown.
9. Slice and serve warm.

1. Cook pasta according to package instructions.
2. In a food processor, blend 2 cups of fresh basil, 1/2 cup of pine nuts, 1/2 cup of grated parmesan cheese, and 3 cloves of garlic until well combined.
3. Slowly pour in 1/2 cup of olive oil while pulsing the mixture until it forms a smooth paste.
4. Toss the cooked pasta with the pesto sauce until well coated.
5. Serve with additional grated parmesan cheese on top.

1. Preheat the oven to 450°F.
2. Roll out pizza dough to desired thickness and shape.
3. Spread tomato sauce evenly over the dough, leaving a small border around the edges.
4. Sprinkle shredded mozzarella cheese over the sauce.
5. Drizzle olive oil over the top.
6. Bake for 12-15 minutes or until the crust is golden brown and the cheese is melted.
7. Top with fresh basil leaves before serving.

1. Cook pasta according to package instructions.
2. In a food processor, blend 2 cups of fresh basil leaves, 1/4 cup of pine nuts, 2 cloves of garlic, and 1/2 cup of grated Parmesan cheese.
3. Slowly add 1/4 cup of olive oil until a smooth paste forms.
4. Drain the pasta and toss with the pesto sauce.
5. Serve with additional grated Parmesan cheese on top.

1. Preheat the oven to 325°F.
2. In a large Dutch oven, heat 2 tbsp of olive oil over medium-high heat. Brown the veal shanks on all sides and set aside.
3. In the same pot, sauté finely chopped onion, carrot, and celery until softened.
4. Add 1 cup of canned tomatoes and 1 cup of beef broth. Stir well.
5. Return the veal shanks to the pot, making sure they are submerged in the liquid.
6. Cover the pot with a lid and bake in the oven for 2-3 hours or until the meat is tender.
7. Serve with mashed potatoes or risotto.

1. Cook pasta according to package instructions.
2. In a food processor, blend 2 cups of fresh basil, 1/2 cup of pine nuts, 1/2 cup of grated parmesan cheese, and 3 cloves of garlic until well combined.
3. Slowly pour in 1/2 cup of olive oil while pulsing the mixture until it forms a smooth paste.
4. Toss the cooked pasta with the pesto sauce until well coated.
5. Serve with additional grated parmesan cheese on top.

1. Preheat oven to 450°F.
2. Stretch pizza dough into a 12-inch round and place on a pizza stone or baking sheet.
3. Spread a thin layer of tomato sauce over the dough, leaving a 1/2-inch border.
4. Add slices of fresh mozzarella cheese on top of the tomato sauce.
5. Bake in the oven for 10-12 minutes or until the crust is golden brown and the cheese is melted and bubbly.
6. Top with fresh basil leaves and drizzle with olive oil before serving.

1. In a large pot, sauté finely chopped onion, carrot, and celery until softened.
2. Add 4 cups of chicken or vegetable broth to the pot.
3. Add diced zucchini, 1 can of canned tomatoes, and 1 can of drained and rinsed kidney beans. Stir well.
4. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and let simmer for 20-30 minutes.
5. Serve with a sprinkle of grated parmesan cheese on top.

1. Cut chicken breasts into thin cutlets and season with salt and pepper.
2. Dredge each piece in flour, shaking off any excess.
3. In a large skillet, melt 2 tbsp of butter over medium-high heat.
4. Add the chicken cutlets to the pan and cook for 3-4 minutes on each side or until golden brown.
5. Remove the chicken from the pan and set aside.
6. In the same pan, add sliced mushrooms and sauté until browned.
7. Add 1 cup of marsala wine to the pan and bring to a simmer.
8. Return the chicken to the pan and let cook for another 5-7 minutes. serve with pickels

1. In a large pot, sauté finely chopped onion, carrot, and celery until softened.
2. Add 1 lb of ground beef to the pot and cook until browned.
3. Add 1 cup of canned tomatoes, 1 cup of beef broth, and 1/2 cup of red wine. Stir well.
4. Cover the pot with a lid and simmer for 1-2 hours.
5. Serve with cooked spaghetti or your favorite pasta.

1. Cook spaghetti according to package directions. 
2. Meanwhile, cook pancetta in a large skillet over medium heat until crisp. Remove with a slotted spoon and drain on paper towels.
3. In a medium bowl, beat together eggs and Parmesan cheese.
4. Drain spaghetti, reserving 1/4 cup pasta water. Add hot spaghetti to skillet with pancetta and toss to combine. Remove from heat.
5. Pour egg mixture over spaghetti, stirring quickly to coat. Thin sauce with reserved pasta water if desired. Serve with black pepper.

1. Heat oil in a large saucepan over medium heat. Add onion, celery, and carrot and cook, stirring occasionally, until vegetables are softened.
2. Add ground beef and cook until browned, breaking up any clumps with a wooden spoon.
3. Add tomatoes, red wine, beef broth, and bay leaf. Bring to a simmer and cook, uncovered, until sauce is thickened and flavors are melded, stirring occasionally.
4. Remove bay leaf and season with salt and pepper. Serve over cooked pasta with grated Parmesan cheese.

1. Preheat oven to 400°F.
2. Slice baguette into 1/2 inch thick rounds and place on a baking sheet.
3. Brush bread with olive oil and bake for 5-7 minutes, or until lightly toasted.
4. Meanwhile, chop tomatoes and garlic and combine in a bowl with chopped basil and a drizzle of olive oil.
5. Top each toast with a spoonful of tomato mixture and serve immediately.

1. In a large bowl, beat together mascarpone cheese and heavy cream until light and fluffy.
2. Brew espresso and let cool.
3. Dip ladyfingers in espresso and arrange in a single layer in a 9x13 inch dish.
4. Spread half of the mascarpone mixture over the ladyfingers.
5. Repeat with another layer of espresso-soaked ladyfingers and remaining mascarpone mixture.
6. Cover and refrigerate for at least 2 hours or overnight.
7. Before serving, dust with cocoa powder.

1. Cook spaghetti according to package directions. 
2. Meanwhile, combine basil leaves, pine nuts, Parmesan cheese, garlic, and olive oil in a food processor and pulse until smooth.
3. Drain spaghetti and toss with pesto sauce until evenly coated. Serve hot.

1. Slice tomatoes and fresh mozzarella into 1/4 inch thick slices.
2. Arrange tomato and mozzarella slices alternately on a serving plate.
3. Sprinkle with chopped basil leaves.
4. Drizzle balsamic vinegar and olive oil over the top. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve immediately.

1. Heat chicken broth in a large saucepan and keep warm over low heat.
2. In a separate large saucepan, heat butter over medium heat. Add onion and cook until softened.
3. Add Arborio rice and stir to coat in the butter.
4. Add white wine and cook until the liquid has been absorbed by the rice.
5. Begin adding chicken broth, one ladle at a time, stirring constantly and waiting for the broth to be absorbed before adding the next ladle.
6. Continue until the rice is tender and the risotto is creamy.
7. Stir in Parmesan cheese until melted. Serve hot.

1. In a large pot, heat chicken broth and canned tomatoes over medium heat.
2. Add diced carrots, celery, and onion and simmer until vegetables are tender.
3. Add cheese tortellini and cook until tender.
4. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve hot.
In a large saucepan, heat the chicken broth over medium heat.
In a separate pan, melt the butter over medium heat. Add the onion and garlic and sauté until the onion is translucent.
Add the rice to the onion and garlic mixture and stir until it is well coated with the butter.
Add a ladleful of the hot chicken broth to the rice and stir continuously until it is absorbed.
Repeat the process with the remaining broth, one ladleful at a time, until the rice is al dente and the mixture is creamy.
Add the Gorgonzola and Parmesan cheese to the rice mixture and stir until the cheese has melted.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Garnish with chopped parsley and serve hot.
Cook the tortellini according to package instructions until al dente.
In a food processor, combine the basil, pine nuts, Parmesan cheese, garlic, and a pinch of salt and pepper. Process until finely chopped.
With the food processor running, slowly add the olive oil in a steady stream until a smooth paste forms.
Drain the tortellini and toss with the pesto sauce.
Serve hot, garnished with additional Parmesan cheese and chopped basil leaves, if desired.
Preheat the oven to 375°F.
Cook the lasagna noodles according to package instructions until al dente.
In a large skillet, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the onion and garlic and sauté until the onion is translucent.
Add the mushrooms, zucchini, and yellow squash to the skillet and cook until the vegetables are tender.
